Articles.Content:
F-4 Phantom

First replica I worked on so its a little rough.  Definitely will be revisiting it at some point since I forgot its a two seater when I was making it.

Actions:

  1. Afterburner
  2. Airbrake Deploy

A-10 Warthog

Everyone's favorite flying gun, with a "working" brrt included.

Actions:

  1. Take-off Flaps

SR-71 Black Bird

"The Lockheed SR-71 Blackbird. An advanced, long-range strategic reconnaissance aircraft, capable of Mach 3 and an altitude of eighty-five thousand feet!"  Not this version though, looking this good in ksp 2 comes at a price and the currency of exchange is drag. Tops out at a little over Mach 1.

AV-8B Harrier II

One of the coolest planes ever imo. Until we get servos added its stuck in s/vtol mode and its performance is pretty weak as a result. Still fun/good for flying around the KSC, once you get used to the controls. 

Tips for flying:

On take-off get to roughly 33m/s and then activate action 3 to take off. Use the flaps on take off and landing only, it leads to instability during turns while in flight. Keep thrust above 80% to keep your nose up, use action group 2 and 4 to slow down and land vertically.

Actions:

  1. Toggle Vertical Thrusters
  2. Toggle Rear Thrusters
  3. Toggle Deploy S/VTOL Flaps
  4. Reverse Rear Thrusters 

 

Craft Files:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1noP8cD36MLxKWhrSGYOMVly7D5fTIT30?usp=sharing
These look great! How did you manage to do the red lining on the SR-71?

32 minutes ago, GOOMH said:

These look great! How did you manage to do the red lining on the SR-71?

I used the xs stabilizer to basically draw lines on the airframe with the rotate and translate tool. I'm pretty sure its one of the major sources of the drag that has its speed capped though so it has its limitations.
